name: Parisian Ratatouille
description: A classic French dish that is easy to make and full of flavor!
ingredients: 1 onion, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 red bell pepper, diced, 1 zucchini, diced, 1 eggplant, diced, 1 can diced tomatoes, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried basil, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the onion and garlic. Cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally., Add the bell pepper, zucchini, and eggplant. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally., Add the diced tomatoes, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine., Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally., Serve warm over rice or pasta.

name: Chicago-Style Italian Beef Sandwich
description: This classic Chicago-style Italian beef sandwich is easy to make and takes only a short time to prepare and cook. It's a great lunch option for anyone looking for a quick and delicious meal.
ingredients: 1 lb. beef roast, 1/2 cup beef broth, 1/4 cup Italian dressing, 1/4 cup giardiniera (pickled vegetables), 1/4 cup pepperoncini peppers, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning, 4 Italian rolls, Provolone cheese (optional)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350F., 2. Place beef roast in a baking dish and pour beef broth over it., 3. In a small bowl, mix together Italian dressing, giardiniera, pepperoncini peppers, garlic powder, onion powder, and Italian seasoning. Pour over the beef roast., 4. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 2 hours., 5. Remove the beef roast from the oven and shred with two forks., 6. Place the shredded beef on the Italian rolls and top with Provolone cheese, if desired., 7. Serve and enjoy!

name: Portland-Style Grilled Cheese Sandwich
description: A classic grilled cheese sandwich with a Portland twist!
ingredients: 2 slices of sourdough bread, 2 slices of cheddar cheese, 2 slices of bacon, 1 tablespoon of butter, 1 tablespoon of olive oil
directions: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the butter and olive oil., Add the bacon to the skillet and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes., Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside., Add the slices of bread to the skillet and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side., Remove the bread from the skillet and place one slice on a plate., Top the slice of bread with the cheddar cheese and bacon., Place the other slice of bread on top and press down lightly., Return the sandwich to the skillet and cook until the cheese is melted, about 2 minutes per side., Remove the sandwich from the skillet and enjoy!

name: Waco-Style BBQ Chicken Sandwich
description: A delicious and easy-to-make BBQ chicken sandwich that is sure to please!
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1/4 cup BBQ sauce, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 2 hamburger buns, 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup sliced red onion
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F., In a small bowl, mix together BBQ sauce, olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, and black pepper., Place chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour BBQ sauce mixture over them. Make sure chicken is evenly coated., Bake chicken for 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through., Remove chicken from oven and let cool for 5 minutes., Meanwhile, toast hamburger buns in a toaster or in a skillet over medium heat., Once chicken is cool enough to handle, shred it with two forks., Assemble sandwiches by layering chicken, cheddar cheese, and red onion on the buns., Serve and enjoy!
